functions.name: RunRule1
functions.description: Nelson Run Rule One. This function creates a condition when any single data point falls outside the control limits from the centerline (i.e., any point that falls outside Zone A, beyond either the upper or lower control limit).
functions.formula: /convert to a step signal /n $signalStep = $signal.toStep() /n //find when one data point goes outside the plus3sigma or minus 3sigma limits /n ($signalStep < $minus3sd or $signalStep > $plus3sd)

functions.name: RunRule2
functions.description: This function creates a condition when 9 consecutive points fall on the same side of the centerline (in Zone C or beyond).

functions.name: RunRule3
functions.description: Nelson Run Rule Three. This function creates a condition when any six consecutive data points are increasing or decreasing.

functions.name: RunRule4
functions.description: Nelson Run Rule Four. This function creates a condition when fourteen consecutive data points are alternating in direction (i.e. increasing then decreasing).

functions.name: RunRule5
functions.description: Nelson Run Rule Five. This function creates a condition when two out of three consecutive points fall beyond the 2σ limit (in Zone A or beyond), on the same side of the centerline.

functions.name: RunRule6
functions.description: This function creates a condition when four out of five consecutive points fall beyond the 1σ limit (in Zone B or beyond), on the same side of the centerline.

functions.name: RunRule7
functions.description: Nelson Run Rule Seven. This function creates a condition when fifteen consecutive points fall within the 1σ limit from the mean (in Zone C).

functions.name: RunRule8
functions.description: Nelson Run Rule Eight. This function creates a condition when eight consecutive points fall beyond the 1σ limit (in Zone B or beyond), with points in both directions from the mean.

docs.name: index
docs.description: Allows creation of the Nelson Run Rules. Created based on Nelson Run Rules.
